p: In the last decades, thanks to the increasing number of studies about medicinal plants and their consequent new applications, further attesting their safety and efficacy, the interest of the market for natural products has been awakened. In this context, H. officinalis subsp. aristatus, already marketed in Europe as an aromatic medicinal plant based on its traditional uses, e.g., as a cooking spice and as a traditional health remedy, evidences however critical issues related to its different chemotypes that must be recognized and standardized in order to attest their efficacy and safety parameters for further guarantee their use by consumers.
